channel.title: NONTHNG - Labrador [Lo-Fi House, Jazzy, Demo]
channel.description:
[NONTHNG - Labrador (Demo Version)](https://soundcloud.com/heathenaka/labrador-demo-version/s-0lHNi) (4:16)
Jazzy, lo-fi house.
Private link for now, until I lock down an artist name for this one. ;)
[![NONTHNG---Labrador-(Demo-Version)|400x400](upload://3a2N472akxy7p7KkmmeQ7wE7KWU.jpeg)](https://soundcloud.com/heathenaka/labrador-demo-version/s-0lHNi)
  Thoughts, comments, feedback, etc… all very welcome.
Enjoy! :slight_smile:

item.title: NONTHNG - Labrador [Lo-Fi House, Jazzy, Demo]
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Jazzy / hip hop (slow breaks) is always something I wanted to explore but it would take quite some time to get to the point where I feel like I know what I’m doing and not just emulating something. I REALLY wish my parents pushed me to learn an instrument in school I think I’d be quite better equipped for production by now

Read full topic

item.title: NONTHNG - Labrador [Lo-Fi House, Jazzy, Demo]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Thanks.

iammane:

the percussion really carries it along

Indeed. The looser feel of the percussion layers, including the greater subtlety in the ‘playing’ velocity, really helps give it a more organic, de-quantised feel.

Playing around with some vocal chops has also helped bring some energy.

Definitely things I need to explore more.

I think I might have overdone the LPF, so perhaps need to open it up just a touch more.

 

more

I’ve got several smooth/jazzy house WIPs that I now plan to explore finishing as Lo-Fi House.

Read full topic

item.title: NONTHNG - Labrador [Lo-Fi House, Jazzy, Demo]
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
I like it the percussion really carries it along and gives it a great funky vibe. Straight four on the floor doesn’t normally do it for me, but the overall funkiness and lo fi aesthetic kept me engaged. I wouldn’t mind hearing more of this for sure

Read full topic

item.title: NONTHNG - Labrador [Lo-Fi House, Jazzy, Demo]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Thanks.

Re: Lo-Fi
Indeed. I think its ‘back to basics’ vibe frees it up to be slightly innovative while also slightly nostalgic.

item.title: NONTHNG - Labrador [Lo-Fi House, Jazzy, Demo]
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
I really enjoyed this!
No meaningful critique, it does what it says on the tin.

I’d also like to second the love of lofi.
IMO, it’s the most interesting sound in house at the moment, and has been for a good few years.

Read full topic

item.title: NONTHNG - Labrador [Lo-Fi House, Jazzy, Demo]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Thanks. It came together quite quickly.
Conveniently, as it’s a genre that’s partly defined by a (purposeful) absence of high-end production finish, it’s a genre that I feel can potentially be taken to release-ready state entirely within Auxy.

I need to review the lead sounds and also put in some detailing on the transitions before I’m happy to push it out properly.

I’ve got a few more on the back burner, so I’ll possibly put the time in for an EP.

 
As a genre, it’s charmingly raw, giving it a slightly primitive, retro feel, and works well with Chicago garage and deep house and analogue jazz and soul vibes.

Reminds me a bit of early house from bedroom producers in the early days of pirate house stations in London.

 
If you’re diving’s into the genre, your first stop would/should probably be someone like DJ Boring and/or Ross from Friends.

Enjoy

Read full topic
